title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message:
820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?

The screen is blurred with lines, and discolored.

Please see attached 2 images:

Any advice what that could be? Bad GPU?

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message:
[QUOTE="TCRScircuit, post: 37865"]100% dead GPU. [/QUOTE]

What abt reflow? You sure its dead this motherboard as well?

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message: Well, if you want to reflow , reflow it but it won't last. Please don't charge the customer if you do that and set no expectation that it will last more than a week.

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message:
[QUOTE="TCRScircuit, post: 37868"]Well, if you want to reflow , reflow it but it won't last. Please don't charge the customer if you do that and set no expectation that it will last more than a week. [/QUOTE]

Cool. thanks TCRScircuit.. I wont charge the customer.. Agree with you. Im always upfront with the customers about the issues at hand. Serves the business best in the long run.. :)

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message:
[QUOTE="TCRScircuit, post: 37868"]Well, if you want to reflow , reflow it but it won't last. Please don't charge the customer if you do that and set no expectation that it will last more than a week. [/QUOTE]

How much temperature do u suggest i reflow the GPU on? and should i use high airflow or slow airflow?

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message: High airflow. Start at 100C and work up to 400C then back down slowly.

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message: Reflow is time wasting bull shit. Why even bother.

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 37918"]Reflow is time wasting bull shit. Why even bother.[/QUOTE]

So do u suggets the customer buy a new motherboard?

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message:
[QUOTE="patrickribbsaeter, post: 37939"]

So do u suggets the customer buy a new motherboard?[/QUOTE]

Ok cool.. thank you.. Will tell my client that..

title: 820-2915 Graphics chip problem or flex cable or something else?
message: I suggest to change the GPU or scrap the machine. There are no new boards and any that are still working are either reflowed garbage or will be dead soon too.
